body.name: Motorola Moto Watch 100 Smart Watch 42-Millimeter GPS for Men and Women,14-Day Battery,24/7 Heart Rate, SpO2, 5 ATM Water-Resistant, AOD, Compatible with Android and iPhone, Black
body.stockDetail: Only 9 left in stock - order soon.
features: SLEEK, STYLISH & LIGHTWEIGHT: The Moto Watch 100 Smart Watch for women and men is built for 24/7 wear and an active lifestyle. It features a 42-millimeter aluminum case, a black silicone band, and a 1.3-inch circular LCD display. This state-of-the-art watch weighs only 29 g.

EXTENDED BATTERY LIFE: This running watch delivers the functionality you need without all the battery-draining apps. After a charge time of just 60 minutes, it offers 2 weeks of full-time use. Enjoy the full convenience of a battery that lasts longer than fresh produce in your fridge!

FEEL YOUR RHYTHM: Establish routines and get more from your grind with this step-counter watch’s notifications, reminders, dynamic health-tracking features, and more than 26 sport modes. The Moto 100 health watch is a comfortable addition to your wrist that helps you unlock your potential.

COMPATIBLE WITH iPHONE & ANDROID: Comfort, style, and accessibility combine to create a device that integrates seamlessly into your daily life. The MotoWatch OS is simple and intuitive and works in harmony with Android or iPhone systems to support your goals.

LOOK GOOD, LIVE BETTER: Kick your workout routine into high gear with this fashionable smart watch women and men love. It provides health tracking with an accelerometer, a gyroscope, a heart-rate monitor, and an SpO2 sensor. The 5 ATM water resistance lets you be active however you see fit.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Feel Your Rhythm Beautifully designed all aluminum smartwatch equipped with dynamic health tracking including more than 26 sport modes, heart rate monitor, sleep tracking and step counting. Multiple lifestyle features, goal setting, and smart notifications put your finger on the pulse of self-improvement.

Untether Yourself with a 14-Day Battery With a battery that boasts up to two weeks of full-time use, one charge lasts longer than the fresh produce in your fridge! A charge time of just 60 minutes helps you power up fast and get more from your grind.

Heart Health, Sleep & Activity Tracking Heath tracking is delivered through an accelerometer, gyroscope, heart-rate monitor and SpO2 sensor. The moto watch 100 upgrades your workouts. Plan your running route with GPS and easily control your music from your wrist. Weather updates help you stay dry.

There Are No Wrong Turns With accurate built-in GPS tracking, you won't get lost. Turn on GPS activity when you are out for walk, run or bike ride and communicate your efforts and achievements with trusted circle on Strava and Google Fit

5ATM WATER RESISTANT Explore more with a splash proof, sweat proof smartwatch. Stay active however you see fit. GAIN HEALTH INSIGHT AT HOME SpO2 sensor measures your blood oxygen saturation levels. Track your steps and all-day heart rate to understand your body's response to exercise. WHAT'S IN THE BOX The moto watch 100 comes with a silicone watch band, a USB POGO pin charging cable, and a Quick Start Guide.

STEP TRACKING Stylish aluminum smartwatch equipped with dynamic health tracking including 26 sport modes. FOLLOW YOUR HEART Heart rate monitor and SpO2 sensor track your all day heart rate for a clear view of your overall health. STAY CONNECTED WITH SMART NOTIFICATIONS Some things can’t wait. Curated notifications deliver important updates when your phone is out of reach.

ONBOARD GPS Leave your phone behind on your next run with a built-in GPS. Connect to the Moto Watch app when you get back and view your route. CONTROL YOUR MUSIC FROM YOUR WRIST Skip tracks or turn up the volume without needing easy access to your phone. SWITCH IT UP Swap your strap in seconds to customize your watch.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Love the great look, quality, info laden smart watch.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Disappointing Product and Customer Service
reviews.reviewText: This watch replaces a Pebble Steel that has been in use since 2016. After six years the battery in the Pebble Steel is waning. The main features I was looking for were similar water resistance, at least one week of battery life and phone media control. As for the later, the Moto 100 only provides media controls for play/pause, previous and next. The Moto Watch does not show active media from the connected mobile device. The Pebble Steel does the later as well as providing volume control. The Amazon listing for the Moto 100 says it will skip tracks or turn up the volume without needing easy access to your phone. This statement is inaccurate.The aluminum case and overall build quality appear quite nice. The battery life is about one week and it charges in about an hour.The PulseOx measurement system is inaccurate in a hypoxemia situation [holding your breath; pulse ox <= 90 %] when the watch reading is compared to a conventional finger style pulse ox device. The Wyze Watch 47 watch has the same deficiency.Here are several other noteworthy items.The magnetic coupling of the charging cable to the watch should be stronger. The cable easily becomes detached if the watch is moved. The cable will not stay connected under its own weight.Unlike the Pebble Steel, the stopwatch will quit timing if one leaves the screen to do something else. The same holds true for the timers.The 10 second duration of the vibration related to the alarm functionality isn’t long enough to wake me up.The short, usually one word or partial word notifications, for example from emails, provided on large LCD touch screen isn’t detailed enough to be readily identifiable.After six weeks of use, the lights associated with the heart rate and PulseOx measurements quit. As a result, the related dynamic health functions fail to work. The next day the watch failed completely and no longer powers up. The product has a two-year warranty. See the photo for the likely culprit.The Motowatch support team requests numerous “quick” videos related to the watch functionality when simple photos suffice. There is nothing quick about the process of sending a 25 MB, 10 second video, [link] via email! The support team should be more considerate of the customers’ time.After more than a week of answering emails from Motowatch and providing needless videos, the watch was replaced by eBuyNow LTD. The replacement lacks any ability to control media playback on the connected smartphone. It’s also worth noting that the magnetic attraction between the charging cable and the watch is much better on the replacement compared to the watch originally received. It’s unclear why there is such variability between presumably identical products.I ultimately received a RMA and returned the product. It took weeks and additional emails before I finally received the promised refund from eBuyNow LTD via PayPal. During this process, eBuyNow LTD customer support claimed more than once being overwhelmed with “logistical problems”. Overall, this entire experience with the seller was very frustrating and time consuming.I went on to purchase an Amazefit GTR 3 Pro LTD which has an OS like the Moto 100, only far better implemented. Except for the PulseOx accuracy, it has none of the faults noted here of the Moto 100.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars It's ok for a first smartwatch
reviews.reviewText: It's okay for first smartwatch. I would rather have less of the sports crap on it. The sports stuff is why I never had gotten a smartwatch. It takes too much battery and memory on my phone. I would prefer the ability to do more of the phone features on it. I wanted one with a name brand and type to be able to order accessories for it. The app reviews said it didn't work. Maybe it doesn't on other types of phones. I don't like that the app is only sports stuff and not phone things but the app works as far as I can tell since I don't use those things. I am curious if Motorola will be coming out with a new smartwatch to go with the better phones they are coming out with. Maybe one with less of the sports things

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Value for money
reviews.reviewText: At its price (I bought at USD 79.99), I think the Moto Watch 100 has done a great job. It is beautiful and well made. The screen is clear, battery life is good. Of cox it has its drawback including not able to sync with Google Fit or Strava. No app can be installed since it is not running Wear OS. The built-in function is good enough for everyday use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewText: It's good at first and it works the way it says. However, not long after owning it you start to really see the issues with it. I can't get it to 100% charge anymore no matter what I plug it into. It will randomly stop working for weeks and then just kick back into gear. I've had more issues with this than positive outcomes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great little watch for the price!
reviews.reviewText: This is a great watch for the price. No it’s not an Apple Watch but I also didn’t pay 500 dollars for it. The watch paired quickly to my Moto G phone. Apps were easy to access and change. Phone calls and text messages come through as notifications on the watch face. The battery life is amazing and lasts much longer than my Apple Watch did. The design is simple yet sleek and attractive. Overall would recommend as a nice little smartwatch to accompany your android.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars The only thing worse than this "watch" is the customer support! DO NOT BUY ONE!
reviews.reviewText: I can't recommend against buying this pile of <junk> strongly enough, and the customer support is unbelievably bad as well. I have pointed out that the product is defective in that it looses the Bluetooth connection to a Moto phone, but they refuse to refund my purchase price.DO NOT BUY ONE!!!!!Bought one of these to use the fall monitoring for an elderly relative. The thing kept loosing the connection to the Bluetooth on a Motorola phone that it was never more than a few feet away from. Customer support for both the watch and the extra cost monitoring service was very bad.Minimum of 4 day turn around on questions, and usually their answer was something like "Ask the fall monitoring people" if it was Moto and "ask Moto" if it was the fall monitoring people.Probably because it was loosing the Bluetooth connection the battery life was only a few days. This device is not reliable enough to use as a life safety device, and it is too expensive for a cheap watch. And to top it off, it is completely unsupported for all practical purposes.My question for the monitoring folks and for Moto was "how do I get the system to make an audible alert on my phone when there is a fall. Their answers were wrong at first, and when I showed them that their answer was wrong, they pretty much went away. This describes both Moto and the monitoring service.

reviews.reviewTitle: It’s a great smart watch! Can’t answer calls with it

reviews.reviewText: Tenias mis dudas al pedirlo pero me ha gustado.El smartwatch me llego un dia despues de pedirlo. El tamaño es adecuado para mi muñeca que no es muy grande. En cuanto a la duracion de la bateria, si lo tienes todo el dia midiendo la presion y la saturacion, se acaba la pila enseguida. Yo solo lo tengo vinculado al telefono y me dura una semana, a eso yo le llamo uso minimo es decir solo recibo las notificaciones del telefono y de vez en cuando la miro hora. Mido la presion y saturacion cuando termine de correr. Tengo una semana con el y estoy contento con el producto. de calidad se siente resistente, quizas las correas vayan a durar poco, pero culquier correa de platico te dura mas bien poco. Solo tengo una queja con la presicion de la lectura de la saturacion: da lecturas superiores a las que me ha dado un oximentro en el dedo al mismo tiempo, habra que tomarlo en cuenta.Al final es un producto economico de bajas prestaciones pero cumple con su cometido. Yo lo compre para iniciar en el mundo del smartwatch y ver que tan funcional puede ser. Quizas mas adelante adquiera uno superior, pero por el momento este me ha gustado. Lo puedo recomendar para principiantes en el uso del smartwatch.Te ayuda a dejar de mirar el telefono a cada momento.
Más de un año con el, excelente producto, muy alta calidad

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice watch and not working within 3 days
reviews.reviewText: I bought this watch paired with my Motorolla Edge + . It worked 3 days. The battery is good and the screen is off and it is hard to turn it on, you have to push on the top bottom. Moving your wrist is not working well. I liked the interface though and it did very well with the SP O2 and the Heart monitor works well too. It did well with the GPS and my run and stationary rowing machine. After 3 days the watch was not paired properly with the Moto Software. I de installed and re installed it 3 times. Then the software recommended an update and after that update the watch does not work at all. Sad, it is now a piece of beautiful junk which I am returning. I thought that a Motorolla/Lenovo product would work well within a Motorolla phone/product, it has not
Hola, mi reloj dejo de prender, apenas llevo un año con el, a donde lo puedo llevar o donde marcar para ver si tiene algún arreglo. Gracias
